text: The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 4 release date and time are not too far away, and viewers are eager to learn all the details. This episode is titled “Day One.” In the previous episode, “The Path,” Ellie learned from Dina that the Washington Liberation Front’s (WLF) headquarters were in Seattle, prompting her to petition the town council to let her leave for the city. Here’s all you need to know. When is The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 4 release date & time? The episode’s release date is May 4, 2025, and its release time is 9 p.m. Eastern Time (ET) and 6 p.m. Pacific Time (PT). Where to watch The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 4 You can watch The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 4 via HBO and HBO Max. HBO is a pay television service, while Max functions as a subscription-based OTT streaming platform. Max provides subscribers with a wide variety of film and television content, spanning genres and languages. The content provided includes originals and licensed properties. In addition, the streaming service also offers subscribers content from other WB Discovery-owned networks like Adult Swim and Animal Planet. What is The Last of Us about? Adapting the story of the video game The Last of Us Part II, the narrative of The Last of Us Season 2 picks up five years from where Season 1 left off. The official synopsis for The Last of Us is as follows: “Twenty years after modern civilization has been destroyed, Joel, a hardened survivor, is hired to smuggle Ellie, a 14-year-old girl, out of an oppressive quarantine zone. What starts as a small job soon becomes a brutal, heartbreaking journey, as they both must traverse the United States and depend on each other for survival.”
